title: Take Me Out hopeful's bodyguard clients includes A-listers like Samuel L Jackson
text:
Get the biggest celebs stories by email Subscribe Thank you for subscribing We have more newsletters Show me See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email

Take Me Out's new series is set to hit our screens this Saturday, and the Flirty Thirty are raring to go.

Among them this year is a girl with some pretty high-profile connections.

39 year-old Tammy is a Close Protection Officer who's kept her watchful eye over none other than Hollywood heavyweight Samuel L Jackson .

She boasts an extensive A-list clientele, including the Avengers and Star Wars star, 70.

The Blackpool native, who's been single for eight months now, is covered head to toe in tattoos, but says she'd not done with the ink just yet.

She's also a keen horse rider and even used to do competitive endurance riding - Tammy made it into the Endurance GB team.

(Image: PA)

(Image: Getty Images for Tyler Perry Stu)

Tammy's got an impressive skill set and an impressive job - and hopes to get hitched by the time she's 40, meaning she's a year to go.

Other contestants include 22 year-old Georgia, who works part time as a bar manager, part time as a princess.

She dresses up a kids' favourite characters at an amusement park, including Harry Potter's evil nemesis Lord Voldemort and Frozen's super-powered Queen Elsa.

Cally, 20, from Basildon in Essex, loves dogs and even heads to a dog shelter to chat to them about boy problems - apparently the pooches are great listeners.

(Image: PA)

The new series will see a bit of a shake-up for the ITV dating hit - including the boys having to conjure up interesting date ideas.

It'll also feature two specials alongside the seven episodes.

One will be an 80s themed bash, with the other giving men and women of the emergency services a chance to flex their romantic muscles.

Host Paddy McGuinness reckons the themes are a great idea, saying: "The first one is an emergency services special, so it's an episode full of firefighters, police and ambulance workers.

"All the girls work within the emergency services and all the lads coming down the lift do as well. We thought it'd be a nice idea to celebrate them all and everything they do."

The funnyman added: "We have done an over-50s special in the past, but this is the decade. It's celebrating the 80s, so I've gone back to my Miami Vice days. I'll be in a white suit with a pastel vest and all the girls will have big hair.

"The music and everything about the show will be 80s. I'm really looking forward to that, it'll be a lot of fun."

Take Me Out returns to ITV on Saturday 26th October at 7:15pm.
description: Tammy from Blackpool is a Close Protection Officer who's looking to find love on Take Me Out's new series
authors: Getty Images For Tyler Perry Stu
